name: n-hexyl acetate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the n-hexyl group (C(C)OCCCCCC) increases the molecular weight and size, which raises the melting point. The acetate group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20°C. The n-hexyl group also introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The net effect is a raised melting point due to the combination of molecular size and hydrogen bonding.
